name: The Night Cafe: A VR Tribute to Vincent Van Gogh
description: The Night Cafe is an environment that allows you to explore the world of Vincent van Gogh first hand. Take a moment to enjoy his iconic sunflowers in 3 dimensions or walk around the chair he painted in his bedroom to see it from another angle. Step into the vivid colors straight from his palette.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel Core i5 Memory: 1024 MB RAM Graphics: Nvidia Geforce 780 GTX Storage: 200 MB available space

reviews.review_text: This is so relaxing and beautiful. Thanks for making it!

Interesting take on Van Gogh and the price is right. Niftly experience for vr. With that said, a note to the devs, for future endeavors You should implement some sort of blocking volume or fix the collision with the walls. You can get close to the wall and look through it to see the other side.
It's interesting, but a waste of time largely. Artsy but in the end nothing much to see here, which is expected I suppose as it is free.

This has been an unexpected top VR experience for me and everyone I've shared it with. The feeling of discovery as you explore really was rewarding. At times I felt like I wanted to cry and ultimately I wanted to just have a seat and drink a cup of coffee for a while. This really struck the perfect balance of honoring the original artwork and adapting it to a modern medium.
Amazing! The colors and the music creates a great atmosphere, it really brings the painting to life!
Absolutely amazing visuals. One of, if not, the best VR games I have played to date. A perfect example of how VR games should be. Very highly reccommended.
One of the best VR experiences I've had! Marvelous creation!

So awesome. If you like traditional painting art work then this is a must try. Feels like Van Gogh painting come to life and you can move around in it and see from all angles. The detail that they created with this experience is amazing. I did it on Vive and it allows roomscale walking around and you can teleport around to see not just one single painting, but the whole cafe with a few rooms. It's not just a still life, but the painting is alive with moving characters. Bravisimo or whatever means f'in awesome. Will keep this to show off to anyone that I show VR to.

This is my go-to app for showcasing VR to first time users. It is very immersive and beautiful. It is not a game or very interactive, really just an experience, but worth having in your library. Wish there were more like it.
Beautiful free app to see what VR can make you feel.
